intro: Mollinedia costaricensis, commonly known as the Costa Rican mollinedia, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks. Mollinedia costaricensis is often found in the understory of tropical rainforests, where it contributes to the biodiversity of the ecosystem.
